entry.def: A program is a set of instructions that a computer follows in order to perform a particular task.

example.ex: The chances of an error occurring in a computer program increase with the size of the program.
example.tran: 计算机程序越长，出错的概率也越大。

entry.def: When you program a computer, you give it a set of instructions to make it able to perform a particular task.

example.ex: He programmed his computer to compare all the possible combinations.
example.tran: 他给他的计算机编制了一套程序，以比较所有可能的组合。

example.ex: ...45 million people, about half of whom can program their own computers.
example.tran: 4,500万人中约有半数可以给他们自己的计算机编制程序

means.word_mean: 1. a system of projects or services intended to meet a public need;

sentences.sentence: "he proposed an elaborate program of public works"
"working mothers rely on the day care program"

means.word_mean: 2. a series of steps to be carried out or goals to be accomplished;

sentences.sentence: "they discussed plans for a new bond issue"

means.word_mean: 3. (computer science) a sequence of instructions that a computer can interpret and execute;

sentences.sentence: "the program required several hundred lines of code"

means.word_mean: 4. an integrated course of academic studies;

sentences.sentence: "he was admitted to a new program at the university"
"did you see his program last night?"

means.word_mean: 6. a performance (or series of performances) at a public presentation;

sentences.sentence: "the program lasted more than two hours"

means.word_mean: 7. a document stating the aims and principles of a political party;

sentences.sentence: "their candidate simply ignored the party platform"
"they won the election even though they offered no positive program"

means.word_mean: 8. an announcement of the events that will occur as part of a theatrical or sporting event;

sentences.sentence: "you can't tell the players without a program"

means.word_mean: 1. arrange a program of or for;
